bibl.title: The Earliest Paper Documents in the Vienna Collection Revisited.
bibl.note: The close examination of palaeography and formulary of the alledgedly early papers indicates a much younger date for most of the documents than suggested by Karabacek. - Pp. 439-441: Edition of P. Vindob. Inv. A.Ch. 9 (= Führer P.E.R. 925). Subscriptions of witnesses. Provenance unknown, July 900.
bibl.seg: Eva Mira Youssef-Grob, The Earliest Paper Documents in the Vienna Collection Revisited.

The close examination of palaeography and formulary of the alledgedly early papers indicates a much younger date for most of the documents than suggested by Karabacek. - Pp. 439-441: Edition of P. Vindob. Inv. A.Ch. 9 (= Führer P.E.R. 925). Subscriptions of witnesses. Provenance unknown, July 900.
